text: There are currently no cases of #MarburgVirusDisease in Nigeria. However, measures have been taken to strengthen preparedness for #MVD in Nigeria. Nigerians are urged to AVOID ALL BUT ESSENTIAL TRAVEL to Equatorial Guinea at this time. Press release: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/440/ncdc-on-alert-following-the-announcement-of-the-marburg-virus-disease-outbreak-in-equatorial-guinea…

This week, we conducted a National Multisectoral Coordination Mechanisms Operational Tool workshop with participants from relevant MDAs & partners The MCM-OT will help strengthen the existing national One Health mechanism and establish a template for sub-national implementation.

Colleagues @NCDCgov and partners are working round the clock battling Lassa Fever in all but 11 States. Health workers on the frontlines continue to step up on containment efforts. During this #Healthworkersweek I really would like to celebrate all who are leading this charge!

It's #WorldHealthDay and #WHO75 The theme '#HealthForAll' calls on the world including #Nigeria to take required actions which can help tackle health challenges today and tomorrow. Everyone everywhere deserves equitable access to basic health services. #UniversalHealthCoverage

Today, we held a refresher training on the 7-1-7 framework, for our disease technical working groups & stakeholders, supported by @ResolveTSL . This framework is a real-time, start-to-end assessment of the turnaround time for the detection & control of infectious disease threats.

The most common signs and symptoms of #Meningitis include: High fever Neck stiffness Vomiting Drowsiness Lack of appetite Sensitivity to light Rashes Seizures Visit a healthcare facility for immediate attention if you observe any of these symptoms.
Visit the nearest vaccination site to receive your Johnson and Johnson single-dose vaccine. All COVID-19 vaccines are free, safe and effective. Get vaccinated today! #YesToCOVID19Vaccine
Seek the advice of a qualified healthcare professional when you feel sick. Self-medication can be harmful. #TakeResponsibility by using antimicrobials appropriately
DÁ ABO BO ARA RE PELU ABÉ RE AJESARA COVID-19 TI JOHNSON & JOHNSON É LEKAN SÓ SÓ KOSI YEGÈ LONI. #YesToCOVID19Vaccine

Meningitis can affect any age group but is more common in children and young adults. Visit a health center facility for immediate attention if you observe any of the below symptoms. #TakeResponsibility to stay safe

Tackling #cholera will always be a priority for @NCDCgov in Nigeria. Yesterday, I met with colleagues from our #Nigeria’s cholera Country Support Platform to discuss our cholera epidemiology, national cholera control plans, vaccines, advocacy, etc. Thanks to @IFRCAfrica folks.

This year, 784 confirmed cases of #LassaFever and 142 deaths have been reported across 23 States in Nigeria. Read more on the epidemiological situation of #LassaFever in Nigeria and our response activities via https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=5&name=An%20update%20of%20Lassa%20fever%20outbreak%20in%20Nigeria…

#LassaFever spreads majorly to humans through direct contact, eating food, or drinking water contaminated with urine, faeces, saliva, or blood of infected rats. Store your foodstuff in rodent-proof containers Maintain a clean environment always Practice hand hygiene

#CerebrospinalMeningitis (CSM) is an easily transmissible disease with confirmed cases reported all year round in Nigeria. Download our latest #CSM situation report for a summary of the disease situation and our response activities https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=6&name=An%20Update%20of%20Meningitis%20Outbreak%20in%20Nigeria… #TakeResponsibility

As health emergencies happen more often, vulnerabilities in communities and underinvestment in public health leave dangerous gaps in preparedness and response. Today we hosted national public health agencies at @WHO to look at how we can close the gaps.

This week, DG @IfedayoTiffy is attending @WHO 's consultation with National Public Health Agencies in Geneva, Switzerland He provided updates on Nigeria's implementation of preparedness & response capacities for public health emergencies with a focus on collaborative surveillance

Reducing the burden of #AntimicrobialResistance does not happen in silos. So in our AMR Health and Hygiene Clubs, we love seeing our #DRASAAmbassadors discuss in groups how they can work together to promote health and prevent #AMR in their communities.

Immunization plays a critical role; • It helps to secure the future of our children and community. • It prevents early childhood death. • Families become more productive. • It prevents childhood diseases. • Immunization saves lives. Can you add to the list?

@NCDCgov works closely with PHS in the execution of its mandate. Today, we handed over four fully equipped Toyota ambulances to PHS for use at our airports and other POEs to manage natural or man-made events requiring action to save lives and protects property and public health!

The NCDC collaborates with principal actors on cross border disease surveillance. The Port Health Services (PHS) of @Fmohnigeria responsible for the reduction of morbidity, mortality and disability due to communicable and non-communicable diseases at Points of Entry/Exit (POEs).

#Cholera is a waterborne disease, with a higher risk of transmission when there is poor sanitation and disruption of clean water supply. Practice and ensure the use of safe water in your homes and communities. #TakeResponsibility

Strengthening Nigeria’s national health security is a joint responsibility Today, the NCDC donated fully equipped emergency response ambulances to the Port Health Services, @Fmohnigeria . We remain committed to protecting the health of Nigerians. #StrongerTogether

Are you an incoming traveller to Nigeria Fill out the Nigeria Health Declaration Form via https://healthapp.ncdc.gov.ng Carefully verify that all filled details are correct Submit the form and download a copy It is FREE of charge.

This year, 676 confirmed cases of #LassaFever and 109 deaths have been reported across 22 States in Nigeria. Read more on the epidemiological situation of #LassaFever in Nigeria and our response activities via https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=5&name=An%20update%20of%20Lassa%20fever%20outbreak%20in%20Nigeria…

Today, Nigeria has achieved yet another feat in the ongoing C-19 vaccination programme. We are excited to announce that 69,607,280 persons representing 60% of the target eligible population have been FULLY vaccinated against C-19,

All healthcare workers are urged to read and share our advisory for healthcare workers on #diphtheria. It includes information on the: Transmission Symptoms Diagnosis/Testing Case definition Case Reporting Treatment Prevention https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/436/diphtheria-health-advisory-for-health-care-workers-amidst-outbreak-in-nigeria…

#COVID19 is still a health threat If you are experiencing symptoms associated with #COVID19, visit the nearest testing centre close to you for diagnosis & treatment #GetVaccinated, the vaccine protects you from severe illness, hospitalisation & death #TakeResponsibility

#Cholera is easily transmitted in areas with poor sanitation and hygiene. #TakeResponsibility to practice and ensure physical and environmental hygiene in your homes and community. To learn more about #cholera, visit: https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/factsheet/50…

It's #RareDiseasesDay We join international advocacy efforts for equitable health systems that meet the needs of people affected by rare diseases to leave no one behind. #UniversalHealthCoverage, #HealthForAll
Dear Healthcare Worker, Remember that many infections present with similar signs and symptoms. Always maintain a high index of suspicion. Test, and then treat.

Parents & caregivers should ensure that their children/wards receive the anti-diphtheria vaccine as recommended in the @NphcdaNG childhood immunisation schedule. Visit a primary health care centre close to you to get the vaccine. #TakeResponsibility

Tetanus and Diphtheria infections can be deadly to a pregnant woman and can cause the loss of the baby. Taking Tetanus and Diphtheria Immunization is important for all Pregnant women. #SupportImmunization

Nigeria has been assessed to be at MODERATE risk of overall importation of the Marburg Virus Disease & its impact on the health of Nigerians In 20 mins, join DG @IfedayoTiffy on @cnbcafrica as he discusses the outbreak of #MVD in Equatorial Guinea https://cnbcafrica.com/live/

Cases of #cholera are recorded mostly during the rainy season To prevent the spread of #cholera, Nigerians are urged to: Only consume water from safe sources Stop open defaecation Dispose of refuse and waste properly Ensure proper drainage of sewage

We are pleased to announce the appointment of Dr. Ebere Okereke @DrEmeruemJnr as our CEO. She has over 30 years of experience as a global health physician in various fields. Read more about her here: https://bit.ly/3EwNjXB Congratulations Dr. Ebere. Welcome to @AfricaPHF

#Cholera spreads through food or water contaminated by the faeces of an infected person. Make your water and food safe: Drink only water from safe sources Do not defaecate around water sources Eat thoroughly cooked foods Wash fruits & vegetables properly with clean water

Today in Kano, DG @IfedayoTiffy & Head of Surveillance @DrLadun made an advocacy visit to @KNSMOH and visited Murtala Mohammed Specialist Hospital & @aminukanoth They met with CMDs & health officials to discuss challenges faced in the response to the ongoing #diphtheria outbreak

They also participated in the state #diphtheria emergency operations centre attended by State stakeholders & partners including @WHONigeria , @UNICEF_Nigeria , MSF, @eHealth_africa etc. Special appreciation to @msf_field for supporting the ongoing response in @TheRealKano .

Kudos to the Kano State Honourable Commissioner for Health and State Epidemiologist for their proactive and synergistic approach in responding to the diphtheria outbreak in the State. #InclusivityinResponse

#Cholera Situation Report Our monthly Cholera Situation Report has been published on our website (week 4). Download and share via https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=7&name=An%20update%20of%20Cholera%20outbreak%20in%20Nigeria…
We Are Live! Join via https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_1G4sU5JbRdK_t5UrKaJWsA…

"#Diphtheria is very much with us given the sub-optimal coverage for pentavalent vaccine. For effective control of diphtheria, we need to ensure: High index of suspicion among health care workers Strong lab capacity Timely access to DAT Vaccination against diphtheria"

Webinar Registration Link Topic: Diphtheria Outbreak in Nigeria: A Case of Re-Emergence or Improved Surveillance 1:00 PM Register in advance for the webinar: https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_1G4sU5JbRdK_t5UrKaJWsA…

RESCHEDULED! The #diphtheria webinar is now rescheduled to 1:00 PM this afternoon due to technical challenges. A new link will be shared for webinar registration and participation. We apologise for the disruption and look forward to you joining us again. Thank you

#TakeResponsibility for you, your family, friends, and community. If you or anyone is at risk for #diphtheria, ensure that they get vaccinated. Why? Because #VaccinesWork and there is a widely available & very safe vaccine that protects against #diphtheria. Get vaccinated today!

Individuals at higher risk of #diphtheria infection are advised to get vaccinated against diphtheria. Visit a primary health care centre close to you to get the vaccine. #TakeResponsibility to stay safe and healthy

Our #diphtheria #NCDCRRT across states continues to support State teams in the ongoing outbreak response. Activities carried out include contact tracing, lab support, advocacy to traditional leaders, sensitisation of healthcare workers, risk communication & health promotion etc.

Today, DG @IfedayoTiffy received the Chair, @AFENETAfrica Board of Directors, Prof Ernest Kenu and other delegates on a visit to NCDC. @AfenetNigeria through NFELTP graduates and residents have been very pivotal to strong field epidemiology and outbreak response in Nigeria.

We also have Rapid Response teams Teams in Kano, Lagos, Osun & Yobe helping with the #Diphtheria response. And in Jigawa & Yobe for #meningitis. Although it feels like we are under siege given the concurrent disease outbreaks, the @NCDCgov will #keeppushing #onwardsandupwards.

It was a privilege to be received by Prof Folasade Ogunsola a long-term @NCDCgov collaborator, microbiologist, #IPC expert and now 1st female Vice Chancellor of @UnilagNigeria . I can still remember her hand washing demonstration while I was a paediatrics resident at @LUTHofficial

Yesterday, I was at the campus of @NCDCgov ’s national reference lab, the Central Public Health Lab, Yaba, Lagos (oldest PH lab in Nigeria). It was a pleasure to hold a town-hall meeting with our Lagos team and to also receive a briefing from the #Diphtheria Rapid Response Team.

Visit a healthcare facility close to you for diagnosis and treatment when you observe symptoms associated with #diphtheria. #TakeResponsibility to limit the risk of spread. https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/435/diphtheria-public-health-advisory-amidst-outbreak-in-nigeria…

We have deployed Rapid Response Teams to Edo, Ondo, Bauchi, Taraba, Ebonyi & Benue States to support ongoing #LassaFever response activities in States Our #NCDCRRT will support contact tracing, case management, risk communication & community engagement activities, among others.
Who can receive the COVID-19 vaccine? The National Primary Health Care Development Agency ( @NphcdaNG ) explains this here. #GetVaccinated #YesToCOVID19Vaccine

This outbreak in some states in Nigeria illustrates the growing risk of emerging & remerging infectious disease outbreaks & the need to strengthen epidemic preparedness efforts in the country to better respond to public health threats. #PreventEpidemicsNaija

Diphtheria is a serious infectious disease caused by the Corynebacterium diphtheriae bacterium. It primarily affects the respiratory system, symptoms include sore throat, fever, swollen glands and weakness. #PreventEpidemicsNaija

Symptoms of #diphtheria include fever, runny nose, sore throat, cough, red eyes, swollen neck & in severe cases, a thick grey/white patch at the back of the throat with difficulty breathing Visit a health facility close to you for diagnosis & treatment https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/435/diphtheria-public-health-advisory-amidst-outbreak-in-nigeria…

#Lassafeverinfo Our latest Lassa Fever Situation Report has been published on our website (week 2). This week's situation report and that of previous weeks can be downloaded via https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=5&name=An%20update%20of%20Lassa%20fever%20outbreak%20in%20Nigeria…

Many of the signs and symptoms of Lassa and Yellow Fever are like those of malaria, typhoid, and other sicknesses. Going to a health facility for early testing and treatment of any fever is important. #TestBeforeYourTreat

Our guidelines on Infection Prevention & Control for #ViralHemorrhagicFevers include standard operating procedures & checklists to be used in the care & management of VHFs such as #LassaFever & #YellowFever Healthcare workers are urged to read & share via https://ncdc.gov.ng/themes/common/docs/protocols/111_1579986179.pdf…

We have published an advisory for healthcare workers on #diphtheria. It includes: Transmission Symptoms Diagnosis/Testing Case definition Case Reporting Treatment Prevention All healthcare workers are urged to read and share via https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/436/diphtheria-health-advisory-for-health-care-workers-amidst-outbreak-in-nigeria…

Today @Fmohnigeria Press briefing, our Dir. Special Duties, Dr Priscilla Ibekwe rep'd DG She provided updates on #COVID19, diphtheria, #LassaFever, & meningitis and encouraged prioritisation of vaccinations as eligible We remain committed to protecting the health of Nigerians.

TUNE IN NOW Join our Head of Diptheria Technical Working Group, Dr Bola Lawal, live on @galaxytv as he provides an update on the #diphtheria outbreak response in Nigeria DStv: #258 Time - 6:30 pm Livestream - https://m.facebook.com/GalaxyTV/?mibextid=LQQJ4d…

#Meningitis spreads mostly from one person to another through respiratory droplets e.g. coughing, sneezing & close contact such as kissing Meningitis can affect anyone at any age. Seek medical attention if you experience symptoms Let's take action to #DefeatMeningitis together

Pre-departure & post-arrival #COVID19 PCR test requirements for all inbound travellers to Nigeria have been suspended A simplified Health Declaration (non-covid-19 specific) shall be completed by all passengers on arrival in Nigeria. @PSCCOVID19 Update https://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng/media/files/Press_Release_-_Relaxation_of_COVID-19_Rules_Ako_221212_210142.pdf…

A suspected case of #LassaFever is any individual with a fever for 3-21 days with symptoms such as vomiting, diarrhoea, sore throat, muscle pain, generalized body weakness, abnormal bleeding, and abdominal pain. Download and read guideline via https://ncdc.gov.ng/themes/common/docs/protocols/92_1547068532.pdf…
DÁ ABO BO ARA RE PELU ABÉ RE AJESARA COVID-19 TI JOHNSON & JOHNSON É LEKAN SÓ SÓ KOSI YEGÈ LONI. #YesToCOVID19Vaccine

#COVID19 can affect anyone. Let us all #TakeResponsibility to limit the risk of infection among all ages. #GetVaccinated #WearAMask in crowded places Wash your hands frequently Cough/sneeze into your elbow Visit a healthcare facility when sick #StaySafe

LIVE Nigeria continues to respond to emerging & re-emerging outbreaks of infectious disease Our Director General @IfedayoTiffy will be live on @NTANewsNow to discuss updates on health security in Nigeria Join the conversation DSTV - #369 Time - 9:00 pm

Healthcare workers are urged to always practice standard precautions while attending to suspected or confirmed cases of #LassaFever. Download and read our 'National Guideline for Lassa Fever Case Management' https://ncdc.gov.ng/themes/common/docs/protocols/92_1547068532.pdf… #StaySafeStayHealthy

#Meningitis is an inflammation of the membranes around the spinal cord & brain. Seek medical attention when you experience signs & symptoms such as: Fever/severe headache Vomiting Drowsiness Rash Seizures Muscle/joint pain Stiff neck #DefeatMeningitis
ICYMI Watch DG @IfedayoTiffy 's interview on @tvcnewsng as he provides an update on #COVID19Nigeria and speaks on the rising cases of #COVID19 in hotspot countries. Catch up

15/n. If you have received one booster dose already, please go get your second booster dose. If you belong in any of the high-risk categories (old age, etc), kindly ensure you adhere to recommended public health safety measures – mask use, hand hygiene and avoid crowded spaces.

14/n. We advise Nigerians to make use of every opportunity the Federal Government has provided via the @NphcdaNG to get vaccinated i.e., receive your primary vaccination which can be two or a single vaccine dose. If you have received two vaccine doses already, go get your booster

13/n. ...severe disease, admissions and deaths among the under or unvaccinated and those with established risk factors – old age, cardiovascular and endocrine co-morbidity, immune suppressive states (disease and/or treatments), etc.

12/n. The Nigerian COVID-19 response continues to be executed via 4 pillars – continued surveillance, genomics surveillance, capacity for surge testing and vaccination. Regardless of SARS-CoV-2 variants in different parts of the world, there continues to be an excess of cases...

11/n. BQ.1.1 took over in Sep2022 and persisted since then. None of these were associated with any increases in case numbers, admissions or deaths. We have not detected BF.7 or XBB.1.5 in country yet (sequencing updates for Dec2022 are in progress).

10/n. In Nigeria, @NCDCgov continues with genomic surveillance. The omicron variant was first detected in Dec2021 and has since become the dominant strain. BQ.1/BQ.1.1 and related sub lineages were first seen in Nigeria from July 2022 and BQ.1 became the dominant from Aug2022...

9/n. BF.7 is also thought to be highly transmissible and sufficiently immune evading. In addition, the ‘poor immune status' of the Chinese population now exposed to high levels of transmission of a rapidly mutating virus may favour the rapid emergence of new variants of concern.

8/n ...is a source of worry as it may spread faster than older omicron sub lineages e.g., XBB or BQ and cause increases in hospitalisation when it becomes dominant. BF.7 (BA.5.2.1.7) is considered responsible for the surge in China but does not appear to be increasing elsewhere.

7/n...with BQ.1 increasing from Nov to 23/12/22 and XBB detected at very low levels from Oct2022. On 30/12/22, @CDC projections were that XBB.1.5 will make up 40.5% of COVID-19 cases. In England, XBB.1.5 went up quickly from Nov22 to about 1.9% of cases as at 24/12/22. XBB.1.5...

6/n As at 03/12/22, BQ.1.1, BQ.1, BA.5 and BF.7 were responsible for 85.1% of cases in the US and XBB.1.5 made up 1.3%. For England, BA.5 (17.1%), BA.2.75 (16.6%) and BQ.1 (59.6%) were dominant (up to 27/12/22). In South Africa BA.5 and sub lineages dominated in Sept-Nov 2022...

5/n...admissions in Dec2022 vs Nov22 (as at 21/12/22). Prior to the current uptick in cases seen in China, the US, the UK and elsewhere, genomic surveillance continued to show the Omicron SARS-CoV-2 variant and its lineage continued to predominate in infections worldwide.

4/n @UKHSA data show 28.8%, 36.3% and 1.6% increases in cases, admissions and deaths (as at 22/12/22 compared to previous period). @CDCgov reports 57.0%, 23.2% and 66.0% increases in cases, admissions and deaths as at 21/12/22 compared to 20/11/22. @HealthZA data shows fewer...

3/n...backdrop of a population that neither has high levels of natural immunity nor high levels of coverage with vaccines with the greatest impact against severe disease, hospitalisation, and death. Cases, admissions & deaths in the England and the US have increased significantly

2/n Our COVID-19 EOC is tracking COVID-19 trends in China, US, UK, South Africa, India and other destinations with high volume traffic to and from Nigeria. The COVID-19 resurgence in China is not surprising giving their recent transition from a zero COVID-19 strategy against a...

1/n The @NCDCgov follows global COVID-19 epidemiology including genomics data as part of the ongoing pandemic response. The NCDC COVID-19 EOC continues to function at level 2 alertness - includes weekly risk assessments to inform the need for action e.g., travel restrictions.

REDNESS OF THE EYE is an early indication of #Measles when observed with symptoms like high-grade fever, running nose, dry cough & tiny spots in the mouth. Please report immediately to a health facility when these symptoms are observed. Visit https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/info/M for more.

Nigerians are advised to continue to #TakeResponsibility. Self-isolate if you test positive for #COVID19 until you recover. Adhere to guidelines for home-based care of mild #COVID19 cases: https://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng/media/files/COVID19PatientsBookforHomebasedCare.pdf… Public Health Advisory: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/429/public-health-advisory-following-the-presidential-approval-for-the-relaxation-of-covid-19-safety-measures-%26-travel-advisory…
#Measles is highly contagious. Isolate all suspected cases of the disease and take them to the nearest health care facility immediately. Read more via https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/info/M

#AntimicrobialStewardship (AMS) instituted at the global, national & subnational levels is recognised as a major strategy to tackle #AMR Our peer-reviewed article appraises the factors influencing the implementation of AMS in Nigerian health facilities https://sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2213716522001977?via%3Dihub…

#Measles is an acute, highly infectious disease with initial symptoms of high fever, cough, runny nose, red eyes & tiny white spots in the mouth. Please immediately report to a health facility if you experience these symptoms. Read more: https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/info/M

Delighted to see that the @GHRUamr @UniIbadan @NCDCgov collaboration that constitutes Nigeria's national reference service for #AntimicrobialResistance #Surveillance was considered worth a muse by @GavinHThomas ../2

What is #Mpox How is it transmitted What are the symptoms What are the recommended #InfectionPreventionandControl measures for the general public and healthcare workers Watch https://youtu.be/cCUu4PXwT0A

ALL health workers must continue to maintain a high index of suspicion for #Mpox. Ensure to take necessary precautions when handling suspected or confirmed cases of #Mpox. Advisory: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/367/public-health-advisory-on-monkeypox…

With a surge in the number of cholera cases in Nigeria, poor sanitation & hygiene can aggravate the situation. @AgulaMusa believes that the cleaner our streets, the healthier we are. That's why he's making this bold step. Find out: https://bit.ly/3PIi940 #SoJoNigeria

Elderly persons & individuals with underlying health conditions are advised to #TakeResponsibility Protect yourself from #COVID19 infection #WearAMask in public places Wash your hands with soap & water Visit the nearest health facility when ill https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/429/public-health-advisory-following-the-presidential-approval-for-the-relaxation-of-covid-19-safety-measures-%26-travel-advisory…
#Mpox is preventable. Let us #TakeResponsibility to practice infection prevention and control measures that have proven to limit the spread of #Mpox infection. #StaySafeStayHealthy
The message is clear; Immunization is FREE, safe and effective and every shot counts. Get your child immunized. #SupportImmunization
#CPHIA2022 starts today! Follow @CPHIA_AfricaCDC for sessions and discussions Live stream: https://youtu.be/-KGSXDhwUQI

#HealthyFutureforAll Good health systems do not just treat sick people, it promotes healthy living. #UniversalHealthCoverage emphasises the need to build a world of strong health systems based on equity, trust, healthy environments, investments & accountability. #UHCDay2022

Know the symptoms of #Mpox. Visit a healthcare facility close to you for accurate diagnosis and treatment when you observe any symptoms associated with #mpox. Do not self-medicate! Public Health Advisory: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/367/public-health-advisory-on-monkeypox… #TakeResponsibility

Are you attending @CPHIA_AfricaCDC 2022 Join, our Head of Surveillance & Epidemiology, @DrLadun and other speakers at the @IncubatorGHAI side event as they discuss 'Advocating for Epidemic Preparedness Financing & Funding Sustainability' Today, December 12 11 a.m. WAT

Just three days to go until the 2nd International Conference on Public Health in Africa! #CPHIA2022 We hope to see you there! Haven't registered yet? There's still time! Learn more here: http://CPHIA2022.com

This best practice initiative, starts 3rd Jan 2023, & is welcomed at the NCDC and comes as we develop our next 5-year strategic plan to ensure ownership and sustainability. Grateful for the tremendous support and work by the @USCDCNIGERIA , @Georgetown and @WHONigeria .

The #PHEMCoE is one of the components of the @CDCgov @CDCGlobal @USCDCNIGERIA Advancing Capacity for Epidemic Preparedness and Response in Nigeria (ACEPRIN) grant, for institutional strengthening & outbreak response that @NCDCgov has been implementing since October 2020.

The Public Health Emergency Management Center of Excellence #PHEMCoE is a global initiative that integrates controlled processes, quality improvement & standards, adopted by National Public Health Institutes to prevent, detect, respond & recover from public health emergencies.

#TodayInNCDC, our DG @IfedayoTiffy & top management, @Georgetown , @CDCgov & @WHO launched the #PHEMCoE Nigeria project This project will combine the @GHSAgenda , #IHR Joint External Evaluation, NPHI Staged Development Tool & various emergency preparedness & response capabilities

#LassaFever can be treated Early symptoms include fever, body weakness, malaise, sore throat, muscle & chest pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, cough & abdominal pain. Early reporting to a healthcare facility when experiencing symptoms greatly increases the chances of survival.

We recognise the committed efforts of @followlasg through @LSMOH led by @ProfAkinAbayomi in ensuring that the State's health security always remains top of the agenda. We #KeepPushing, #OnwardandUpward

This week, our event-based surveillance technical manager, @ladyjayakano represented us at the Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources Global Technical Meeting in Egypt The 3-day meeting focused on “The dawn of a new era for Public Health Intelligence"& other PHI-relevant topics
On behalf of ministers gathered at the #GHSAMinisterial2022, @JaneRuth_Aceng presented the New Seoul Declaration extending GHSA for a 3rd 5-year phase (1 Jan 2023 - 31 Dec 2028)

Our Dir. of Special Duties, Dr Priscilla Ibekwe representing @NCDCgov at the #GHSAMinisterial2022 , joined the expert discussion on 'GHSA Sustainable Financing for Preparedness Action Package' She shared our in-country experience with mobilising domestic resources for health.
Early and accurate diagnosis of #LassaFever increases the chances of survival. Avoid self-medication. Visit a healthcare facility close to you when ill for prompt treatment. #LassaFeverInfo

It was a pleasure to speak to colleagues @IANPHIhealth 2022 annual meeting about @NCDCgov building back better from the impact of pandemics, conflicts and climate change on Public Health in Nigeria. I highlighted the importance of #NPHIs in consolidating investments in response.

This week, I have joined colleagues from #NPHIs and MOH units/depts worldwide responsible for EPR at the annual @IANPHIhealth meeting hosted by @Folkhalsomynd . It was a pleasure to meet the @IANPHIhealth president, Duncan Selbie. #NPHI

@ResolveTSL and #IANPHI released an issue brief on the development of National Public Health Institutes, co-authored by @DrTomFrieden and IANPHI President Duncan Selbie A must-read for countries thinking about establishing #NPHIs Read here http://fal.cn/3u6DJ

#Ebola Travel Advisory Avoid all but essential travel to UGANDA Avoid contact with obviously sick persons/#EVD suspected cases Call 6232 (free of charge) if you have recently returned from Uganda within the past 21 days & feel symptoms of #EVD https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/423/public-health-advisory-following-declaration-of-ebola-virus-disease-outbreak-in-uganda…

Our responsibility now is to protect the drugs that we have so that we can slow down the rate of resistance. We should use the few working antimicrobial drugs that we have today, responsibly. – @ProfOduyebo #WAAW2022

Humans too develop #AntimicrobialResistance from food-producing animals, where a resistant microbes share genetic information from animal products (milk, eggs, meat) handling the animals, transporting, exporting across countries, or ingesting them as food. – @ZoKadri #WAAW2022

Antimicrobial use in humans is different from food-producing animals, even though we share the same pathogens. The difference is in quantity/dosage, reason for use, growth promotion. This is why the food business sector needs to be involved in #AMR. – Dr. @ZoKadri #WAAW2022

Years ago, before Antimicrobials were discovered, simple cases of boil, diarrhoea or wound from surgery could lead to death. If #AntimicrobialResitance is uncurbed, a time will come when infections will no longer be treatable with the drugs we have now. – Dr. @ZoKadri #WAAW2022
"Whether you're a doctor who gives antimicrobials or a patient who receives it, we must all learn to handle antimicrobials with care." – Prof. @ProfOduyebo #WAAW2022
LIVE NOW! "You, Me, and The Supergerms: Preventing Antimicrobial Resistance Together" Click to join

This week's #NHWPost is an illustrated piece as part of activities to commemorate #WAAW2022. How can we work together to prevent antimicrobial resistance? Read: http://bit.ly/3guCP2d #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek2022

TODAY! What happens when the #antimicrobial drugs used in treating infections in humans & animals become ineffective? At 6 PM, join the @drasatrust 's conversation on "You, Me, and The Supergerms: Preventing Antimicrobial Resistance Together" Share https://bit.ly/DRASAWAAW22
#Lassafever is preventable. Be a guardian of proper hand hygiene in your community Promote frequent #handwashing with soap and running water. #LassaFeverInfo

Preparing for the next outbreaks must become a clear & consistent focus in our federal & state budgets. Watch as citizens share their thoughts on the #COVID19 response & recommendations to strengthen Nigeria’s health security: https://youtu.be/zLkYYYoNn7w #PreventEpidemicsNaija

ICYMI "#AntimicrobialResistance requires the efforts of the Human, Animal & Environmental sectors & also a whole-of-society approach to manage" Watch our #AMR programme co-ord. @tokwor7 , as she discusses the impact of #antimicrobial misuse in Nigeria

We are currently doing 3 major things to slow and stop the #Ebola in Uganda: - Engaging with the affected communities - Strengthening the health system, particularly in the area where many cases have been reported. (1/2)

#COVID19 home-based care is recommended for patients who do not show symptoms of the disease or have only mild symptoms such as headache, fever or fatigue. Patients & caregivers are advised to strictly follow the home-based care guide https://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng/media/files/COVID19PatientsBookforHomebasedCare.pdf…

#AntimicrobialResistance is when medicines like #antimalarials, tetracycline, septrin, Amoxycillin no longer treat diseases they cure previously. Using antimicrobials "anyhow " is making the treatment of common infections more difficult. #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek2022

#Monkeypox is preventable. Avoid contact with sick/dead animals Cook all animal meats & products properly before eating Wash hands after handling animals & caring for/visiting sick people Avoid close/skin-to-skin contact with infected persons or persons showing symptoms

National public health institutes #NPHIs are key to strengthening health security through coordination of preparedness for preventing disease outbreaks, and the response when they occur. Yesterday, I was glad to discuss Nigeria’s experience with @NCDCgov with the @DOHgovph team

Home-based care refers to when a laboratory-confirmed #COVID19 patient is provided with required medical care at home. Care is provided by an assigned caregiver who may be a family member, a friend, or an identified person. Read https://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng/media/files/COVID19PatientsBookforHomebasedCare.pdf…

Healthcare workers are most at risk of person-to-person transmission of #LassaFever. Always maintain a high index of suspicion for #LassaFever and practice standard precautions always while attending to patients. Healthcare workers advisory: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/351/lassa-fever-healthcare-workers-advisory…

Today, the #NCDCTeam led by DG @IfedayoTiffy held a bilateral knowledge-sharing session with @DOHgovph . The session focused on our best practices & model of resource mobilisation to effectively mount a public health response against infectious disease threats. #StrongerTogether

#AntimicrobialResistance is a global concern affecting everyone, everywhere, including users & non-users of #antimicrobials. #Antimicrobials include #antibiotics, #antivirals, #antifungals & #antiparasitics used to prevent/treat infections in humans, animals & plants. #WAAW2022

Based on available data, the overall risk of importation of the #EbolaVirusDisease and the impact on the health of Nigerians has been assessed as HIGH. Read our public health advisory for measures to prevent the importation of #EVD: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/423/public-health-advisory-following-declaration-of-ebola-virus-disease-outbreak-in-uganda…

This week, the staff of NCDC celebrate our Dir. of Surveillance & Epidemiology, @ElsieIlori as she retires from civil service We’re grateful for her commitment, hard work & outstanding leadership during her years of service. We wish her continued success in future endeavours.

COMING UP In 30 minutes, our Deputy Incident Manager, #cholera Emergency Operations Centre, Dr Muntari Hassan, will be live on @kapitalfm929 to speak on Nigeria's preparedness measures for #Ebola and the ongoing response to #cholera. Tune in: 92.9 FM 4:30 pm

This week, in collaboration with @biomerieux , our #AMRTeam visited Gwarinpa General Hospital, Wuse District Hospital and @FMCAbuja , in Abuja to create awareness among patients on #AntimicrobialResistance and the effects of misuse of #antibiotics. #WAAW2022

54 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Taraba-13 Kano-6 Lagos-6 Oyo-6 FCT-4 Kaduna-4 Delta-3 Nasarawa-3 Bauchi-2 Bayelsa-2 Plateau-2 Rivers-2 Abia-1 266,192 confirmed 259,532 discharged 3,155 deaths #TakeResponsibility

NB: Our #COVID19 case update is now WEEKLY This report includes: Data for 29th October - 4th November 2022 3 states with zero cases: Abia, Ekiti & Sokoto For a breakdown of cases by state: http://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng

Zoonotic, water/food borne & vector-borne diseases eg. #cholera, #LassaFever, #measles, #monkeypox etc. repeatedly pose threats to humans & animals with significant disability & death rates Nigeria's #OneHealth strategic plan aims to tackle this challenge https://ncdc.gov.ng/themes/common/docs/protocols/93_1566785462.pdf…

Our vaccination site finder mobile app is another unique way of bringing vaccination sites close to the people. To locate the nearest vaccination site to you, visit http://vacsitefinder.nphcda.gov.ng for both routine immunization for children and #COVID19 vaccines for eligible persons.

#Ebola Travel Advisory Avoid all but essential travel to UGANDA Avoid contact with obviously sick persons/#EVD suspected cases Call 6232 (free of charge) if you have recently returned from Uganda within the past 21 days & feel symptoms of #EVD https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/423/public-health-advisory-following-declaration-of-ebola-virus-disease-outbreak-in-uganda…

Ebola Travel Advisory Avoid travel to locations where cases of Ebola has been reported Know the symptoms of #EbolaVirusDisease Call 6232 (toll free) if you have recently returned from Uganda & feel unwell #StaySafeStayHealthy

#Monkeypox is transmitted from human to human through contact with an infected person or contaminated materials and exposure to respiratory droplets. Visit a health facility close to you for proper treatment if you notice #monkeypox-associated symptoms. #StaySafeStayHealthy

Vaccines are one of the best tools we have to improve health and well-being around the world. #TakeResponsibility, encourage your loved ones and those around you to #GetVaccinated. Visit https://vacsitefinder.nphcda.gov.ng to locate the nearest vaccination site to you.

A National #EVD Emergency Operations Centre operating from @NCDCgov ’s Incident Coordination Centre is on alert mode to mitigate the impact of a potential Ebola virus disease outbreak. Read more on measures instituted to limit the risk of importation https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/418/ncdc-on-alert-mode-following-the-outbreak-of-ebola-virus-disease-%28evd%29-detected-in-uganda…

A clean environment helps to prevent the spread of #cholera . Do not defecate in open areas Only drink water from safe sources Boil water before drinking Properly dispose garbage from your homes Ensure proper clearing of sewage

Confirmed cases of #COVID19 are still being recorded across Nigeria. #TakeResponsility: Get vaccinated Always wear a face mask in crowded spaces Wash your hands frequently with soap under running water Cough/sneeze into your bent elbow

Our #COVID19Nigeria situation report(Epi Week 39 & 40) has been published The situation report provides a summary of the epidemiological situation, datasheet & response activities in Nigeria This report is now published BI-WEEKLY https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=14&name=An%20update%20of%20COVID-19%20outbreak%20in%20Nigeria… #TakeResponsibility

Nigeria is at HIGH risk of an #Ebola outbreak given the proximity of Uganda, as well as other factors including: Unavailability of licensed vaccine for prevention Increased air travel between Nigeria & Uganda High death rate of the disease Read: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/418/ncdc-on-alert-mode-following-the-outbreak-of-ebola-virus-disease-%28evd%29-detected-in-uganda…

Visit a healthcare facility when experiencing symptoms associated with #Monkeypox for diagnosis and proper care. Symptoms include: Sudden fever Headache Body pain and weakness Sore throat Enlargement of glands Rash on the face, palms, soles of the feet and genitals

Requires a medical diagnosis Lab tests or imaging often required Spreads in various ways Short-term: resolves within days to weeks Ensure you take your children (9months to under 5 years) to be vaccinated against measles in the nearest health facility to you.

Measles is an acute and highly infectious disease caused by a virus. It is one of the leading causes of morbidity and mortality among under 5 children and can spread from one infected child to another. Preventable by vaccine Treatable by a medical professional
#WHS2022 sessions are underway! Game Changer: Architecture for Pandemic Preparedness Tune in online for free: https://worldhealthsummit.zoom.us/j/83601906020 #MakingTheChoiceForHealth

"Local response, community based surveillance, technical workforce is central to epidemic preparedness. We have to get to the last mile of health delivery at community levels which is also the first mile of health security." -Mike Ryan, @WHO
Actions to improve Nigerian's health should include mainstreaming health in every sector - Prof. Obinna Onwujekwe at the #PoliticsOfHealthNG conference. #FHC2022

All levels of government in Nigeria, as well as traditional leadership structures, civil society, the private sector, religious organisations & communities all influence health and have valuable contributions to make to health - Prof. Obinna Onwujekwe #PoliticsOfHealthNG #FHC2022

Health is often time seen as a consumer expenditure and a not a contributor to social and economic development. Health is an investment and there is a proper link between health and development - Prof. Obinna Onwujekwe, @TheLancet Nigeria Commissioner #PoliticsOfHealthNG #FHC2022

Today, the National Technical Committee of the Regional Disease Surveillance Systems Enhancement #REDISSE held its quarterly meeting for a review of the project's implementation The @WorldBank -funded #REDISSE project aims to strengthen health security in the ECOWAS sub-region.

The ongoing cholera outbreak has been exacerbated by limited access to clean water, open defecation, & poor hygiene practices We call for a whole-of-society approach to strengthen Water, Sanitation & Hygiene to STOP the recurring outbreaks of cholera. https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/420/stop-cholera%3A-strengthening-water%2C-sanitation-and-hygiene%C2%A0%28wash%29-in-nigeria…

"While there is currently no case of #EVD in Nigeria, we have the diagnostic capacity to detect the disease. This capacity will be scaled up to other labs across our network. Active case search is also carried out for returnees from Uganda at Points of Entry" - @IfedayoTiffy

In 2019, we developed a national #Monkeypox guideline to provide technical guidance on the prevention, detection & response of monkeypox and create awareness of the epidemiology and control measures of #MPX. Download, read, and share guideline via https://ncdc.gov.ng/themes/common/docs/protocols/96_1577798337.pdf…

The #Monkeypox virus can spread through contact with an infected person or animal. Ensure you cook all animal food products properly Avoid unnecessary physical contact with animals or with persons infected with #MPX Wash your hands frequently with soap under running water

#Meningitis is an inflammation of the membranes around the spinal cord & brain. Seek medical attention when you experience signs & symptoms such as Fever/severe headache Vomiting Drowsiness Rash Seizures Muscle pain Stiff neck #DefeatMeningitis #WorldMeningitisDay

Following the Outbreak of the #Ebola Virus Disease detected in Uganda, the National Emerging Viral Haemorrhagic Fevers Technical Working Group coordinated at @NCDCgov conducted a rapid risk assessment to inform Nigeria’s preparedness. Press release https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/418/ncdc-on-alert-mode-following-the-outbreak-of-ebola-virus-disease-%28evd%29-detected-in-uganda…

We’re still living with #COVID19, even if cases seem low. Help less people get sick by taking six simple steps: Get vaccinated Keep a safe distance Wear a mask Cover sneezes/coughs Open windows Clean your hands Your health is precious.

#Meningitis is a medical emergency that can be deadly & can cause long-lasting impacts such as brain damage, hearing loss, organ damage & limb loss. Early recognition saves lives. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience associated symptoms. #DefeatMeningitis

Healthcare workers are advised to always practice standard precautions when caring for patients. Maintain a high index of suspicion for #Monkeypox, especially for patients presenting with fever and vesicular/pustular rash. Advisory: https://ncdc.gov.ng/news/367/public-health-advisory-on-monkeypox…

Ko kun san cewa allurar rigakafin COVID-19 ta Johnson & Johnson allura daya ce mai bada kariya? Ku garzaya asibiti mafi kusa daku domin ku karbi rigakafin COVID-19. Allurar COVID-19 bata da wata illa ga jikin dan adam. #YesToCOVID19Vaccine

#Lassafever infection can be prevented. Store grains and foodstuffs in rodent-proof containers Maintain a clean environment Always wash your hands with soap under running water Read our latest Lassa fever situation report via https://ncdc.gov.ng/diseases/sitreps/?cat=5&name=An%20update%20of%20Lassa%20fever%20outbreak%20in%20Nigeria…

Yesterday, NCDC Directors @chinwe_ochu & Dr Priscilla Ibekwe joined @DrTedros & other world leaders at the #UNGA side event convened by P.M @miaamormottley & @GLGAMR to discuss political leadership to fight #AntimicrobialResistance. #Health4All #UNGA77

Behavioural change is key to curbing the spread of #cholera. Always ensure to: COOK all foods PROPERLY before consuming WASH your hands frequently with soap and running water STOP open defecation BOIL water before drinking USE water from safe sources #EndCholera

One of the minimum @WHO IPC requirements is to build a strong network of secondary & tertiary health facilities conducting healthcare-associated infection surveillance Our #TurnNigeriaOrange strategy supports health facilities in building functional IPC programmes at all levels

Last week, working with other major stakeholders, we began implementation of a 6 month pilot of Post-Caesarian Section Surgical Site Infection surveillance across the 6 geopolitical zones. This pilot will inform a core part of the national HAI surveillance strategy for Nigeria.

As a learning organisation, @NCDCgov adapts lessons from response to outbreaks such as #LassaFever & #COVID19 to improve our public health emergency preparedness. This new article led by @FatimaS63028026 and published by @GlobalHealthBMJ tells our story.

#NCDCPublication In October 2020, Nigeria reported an upsurge in cholera cases which transitioned into an epidemic in 2021 This retrospective analysis studies the epidemiology, diagnostics & factors associated with mortality during the epidemic Read https://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/12/9/e063703…
Worried about #monkeypox? @WHO explains what you need to know to keep yourself and others safe and healthy during the current outbreak. @NCDCgov @WHOAFRO @AfricaCDC @Ecowas_cdc

As of 12th September, Nigeria has recorded 264,617 confirmed cases of #COVID19. #TakeResponsibility to limit the spread, protect yourself & your loved ones: Get vaccinated Wear a face mask when in crowded places Wash your hands frequently Cough or sneeze into your elbow

Today, DG represented by @OlaoluAderinol1 , joined the @Fmohnigeria press briefing to provide updates on the response to #COVID19, #Monkeypox & other diseases As we rely on scientific evidence to inform the national response, we urge Nigerians to #TakeResponsibility to stay safe.

Nigeria's #OneHealth strategic plan implementation requires multidisciplinary & intersectoral collaboration which cuts across several key sectors Last week, we held a 3-day stakeholders meeting to build the capacity of focal persons on operationalising #OneHealth across Nigeria.

Millions of children miss out on basic childhood vaccines every year. Getting your child vaccinated is the best way to give every child a healthy start to life and protect against preventable diseases from birth into old age. #SupportImmunization

Last week, our Director of Special Duties, Dr Priscilla Ibekwe joined the @WHOAFRO webinar on the Regional Framework to Defeat Meningitis by 2030. She highlighted experiences, best practices and lessons learnt from the field in the fight to reduce #meningitis in Nigeria.

#Cholera is characterised by rapid onset of profuse watery diarrhoea (rice water stools), with or without vomiting. Prevent the spread: Keep your environment clean Drink or use water that is boiled and stored safely Ensure food is properly cooked Avoid open defecation
If you are due for your second dose, kindly visit the nearest PHC Centre to you or visit to complete your doses. All COVID-19 vaccines are free, safe and effective. #YesToCOVID19Vaccine

Getting both doses of Moderna, AstraZeneca or Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines maximizes your ability to receive full immunity from the vaccine. Receiving only one dose does not provide you with the full protection and does not give you the full effectiveness of the vaccine.

Yesterday, we launched our Data Analytics & Visualization Tool #DAVT developed with the support of @UMBaltimore @USCDCNIGERIA & @IHVNigeria #DAVT is an analytical dashboard developed to support surveillance & response at @NCDCgov & State Public Health Emergency Operation Centres

This dashboard, designed with the capacity to integrate other #surveillance reporting platforms that may be built in the future, enables us to improve our data quality management processes. #BuildingBackBetter

This Monday, I attended the @pan_ng town hall meeting where findings from the human-centred workshops on improving the demand, delivery, and uptake of routine immunisation in Nigeria were shared. This was done in collaboration with the @AmerAcadPeds . It was good to see old faces.

Public health safety measures such as hand washing, physical distancing & proper use of facemasks in crowded places are very effective in limiting the risk of the spread of #COVID19. #TakeResponsibility, stay safe and healthy

Every day is an opportunity to make the right decision for you and your family. Support Immunization. Get vaccinated against COVID-19 and ensure your kids are up to date with their vaccination. #YesToCOVID19Vaccine #SupportImmunization

At the @WHO Meeting on Pathogen X today, I joined colleagues to discuss ‘Tips to prepare for the future’. On lessons learnt from #COVID19, I highlighted the need for data-driven decision-making, contextual application of science & ensuring community ownership of disease control.
